Record.Value: Welcome Cadet. It's time to test your ability to provide sustenance for yourself far, far from home.
In this phase of testing, we'll look at your ability to grow food, then cook it up into something useful. The first step is to create a water network . The water tank will be your water supply
Build The tank connecter in the highlited postion
Put the water tank on the tank connecter.
Use wrench to connect water tank to tank connector.

Excellent, the tank connector allows you to connect dynamic tanks to pipe networks - in this case, a water network. Blue pipes will only transport liquid. Finish the pipe network by connecting the pipes to the hydroponic tray array.
Place the last pipe and Finish pipe system
Before you plant anything, set up a grow light. Plants need light to grow, but a grow light will allow you to grow all through the night, too.
Get grow light kit from crate
Place grow light in highlighted position

You can grow a variety of plants in your base, using a range of different systems and atmospheric combinations. But today, we're just testing the basics. So, now you've got water and light, plant wheat in each of the hydroponic trays.
Plant wheat in the hydroponics trays.

Plants require specific proportions of gases to grow. We'll be testing your skills with gas systems in the next phase, but for now, just wait for the wheat to grow. We've added a little super fertilizer to speed things up.
It's harvest time! You can eat raw wheat - if you like - but it will provide more nourishment if you process and cook it. Use the reagent processor to turn the wheat into flour.
Now you have flour, let's get baking. You can cook a variety of foods in the microwave - including muffins. Sound delicious?
You're about to recieve one of Agrizero's finest muffins. Enjoy it, and banish that hunger, cadet.

Well done, cadet. You've demonstrated a high degree of self-sufficiency, and a decent culinary talent. The Stationeer Command will be proud of you. Press the mysterious blue button to transmit your results.
